item.title: About the Minecraft category
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

(Replace this first paragraph with a brief description of your new category. This guidance will appear in the category selection area, so try to keep it below 200 characters. Until you edit this description or create topics, this category won’t appear on the categories page.)

Use the following paragraphs for a longer description, or to establish category guidelines or rules:

  • Why should people use this category? What is it for?

  • How exactly is this different than the other categories we already have?

  • What should topics in this category generally contain?

  • Do we need this category? Can we merge with another category, or subcategory?

Posts: 1

Participants: 1

Read full topic

item.title: Would anyone be interested in a map reset?
item.dc:creator: @omgilikepie omgilikepie
item.description:
@omgilikepie wrote:

The current map we are playing on is a few years old. There are a lot of broken things due to all the updates that have happened over the years and some ugly chunk borders. A lot of the ores have been mined out and caves/strongholds/etc explored and you have to go far out now to get to unexploited areas now. It’s not a guarantee at the moment that it will be done, we would just like to get a general feel of the community on the current world and go from there.

Posts: 38

Participants: 14

Read full topic
item.source: Would anyone be interested in a map reset?

item.title: Does server need a tree farm?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Not sure if anybody will remember a tree farm that I used to have back when there were 3 worlds all locked within 1000x1000. I had an oak tree farm with around 300 trees. I let anybody come for wood and even had a chest for free wood or sapplings. Only requirement was that if you cut something down you had to plant something back. I always make a tree farm within any settlement that I start (currently a man-made cave). Before I get too much going I figure I would like to know if there is a need for this kind of farm again. Back then since there was a limited land it was very useful.

PS: I am a theif of 2 full stacks of carrots, shears, and one stone axe. Just putting it out there.

Posts: 2

Participants: 2

Read full topic
item.source: Does server need a tree farm?

item.title: Show us what you are working on!
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

A thread to show off your current projects, whether it be a starter house or a massive base of operations we’d love to see it.

Here is a project myself and Kickingjamie have been working on for the last while. An incomplete Norse(?) themed village out in a Taiga biome.

The first house you enter. Portal from the nether tunnel that connects to the nether hub.

item.title: Need Dirt :)
item.dc:creator: @317guy 317guy
item.description:
@317guy wrote:

Hey everyone i’m Building a big project on the server and i need your help, If anyone has any dirt/grass they could spare please donate it to me, I set up a little donation room, I don’t want to give away many details about the project but it is something exciting for all current/new players.

What is it for?
[spoiler]
I’m building a landscape, I’m not going to tell you of what or where though, I’m only saying this because i don’t want everyone excited than abandon the project(Due to any reason), And disappoint people i will release what it is when I’m near completion

(“Not building this near spawn”)
[/spoiler]

The little donation room is behind the barn, In the spawn.

If your still confused click the spoiler below for pictures of where it is.
[spoiler]
Go behind the barn

Down the trap door

And inside this room

Please put a sign on your chest so i can give you credit when i finish the project.

[/spoiler]
Thank you if you donate will save me heaps of time

item.title: Nether portals driving me crazy (White list server)
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

so i currently live underground, and about 250 blocks away is a ocean monument which i raided and killed the elder guardians and plan on making it my new home. I dry out a room with sponges and set up a nether portal so i can easily clean up the monument and have a easy line to get my supplies. I set it up, light it, mark the coordinates so i can make it in the nether too, jump in, and it takes me to my original houses nether portal in the nether (to be expected) so i divide x and z by 8 the usual, and make the new portal for the monument in the nether and enter it, and im sent into some random cave like 100 blocks away from the portal i made in the monument with a newly generated portal that for whatever reason it took me to instead, so i break it, flood the cave, go into the ocean monument again, enter the portal in the overworld again and it sends me to the one i made for it in the nether like it should, but when i go back to the overworld through that same portal, it sends me to a newly generated portal every time, i smash the portals, block them off, and try again and it even goes to the lengths of sending me into the air rather than linking to the portal in the ocean monument, why is this happening?! Someone please help me out

Posts: 5

Participants: 2

Read full topic
item.source: Nether portals driving me crazy (White list server)

item.title: MC-Ajax | OP Factions | lots of Kits | Cheap Donor Ranks | lvl 50+ | 27/7 | PVP
item.dc:creator: @herobrine_creeps herobrine_creeps
item.description:
@herobrine_creeps wrote:

Our server is an OP Factions server meant to have no lag with a DDos Protection. In our server we run 24/7 with the best care for all of our players no matter what. We have kind staff that will help you with problems and/or bugs you face on the server. Our server is a 24/7 OP Factions server with a kind community to keep you happy.

Our server provides cheap priced ranks that give you lots of commands to keep you satisfied, We have Lots of choices for you to buy from, from our Donation store. All money that is sent to us will go to the Development of the server and the Ownership team to keep the server up and running and to make players have a good experience on our server.

Remember to respect all staff and to sign up for Mod at the forums if you want! and when u sign up the conformation email may be sent to the Spam Messages area. Thank you and have fun!

Ranks:

Coal - $4
Iron - $10
Gold - $20
Diamond - $33
Emerald - $70

Check the Donation Store for more info on them

Links:
Visit us! http://www.mcajax.com
Wanna Donate? http://mcajax.minecraftmarket.com
Need help? support@mcajax.com
IP: play.mcajax.com

item.title: Free advertisements for your server
item.dc:creator: @error.login cane
item.description:
@error.login wrote:

As a sort of give back to this community, if anyone would like me to advertise their minecraft server on my website (free of charge) then reply to this thread with a in-game image of something interesting on your server, what version it is, server ip:port, and a little description. If you have a website you can also include this, but it will be a no-follow link.

For a little information on this website, I am targeting a 20k/month search term in Google, so once its ranked you such see a traffic increase.

Participants: 1

Read full topic

item.title: Mojang sold to MS for 2.3B
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

So what do you guys think about this? Notch sold the Minecraft franchise entirely to Microsoft for 2.3Billion.

Personally I feel he let me down a bit out of anybody he could have sold to. Microsoft will and always will be a bad company for this. Through history with any other games they own it was a Windows/Xbox exclusive. I’m wondering how Microsoft will handle this since its already released on iOS, Android, Mac, Linux, and PC.

Been discussing it with a cousin of myn and he feels MS will try to add in DLC content instead of making this all free updates for the life of the game.

Posts: 13

Participants: 8

Read full topic

item.title: SP HungerGames
item.dc:creator: @vovik_ukr vovik ukr
item.description:
@vovik_ukr wrote:

[center]
[B]Server Name: [/B]
SP Hunger Games

[B]Max Players: [/B]
132

[B]IP:[/B]
sunnyparadise.no-ip.info

To get to our HG server from the hub, simply open the hub tool(The book) and click on the “Sunny Paradise” item, which is the Diamond Sword. There’s also a big sign that says “HG” that will have a portal under it. You can step through that or use the hub tool(The book)

[B]Minecraft Version:[/B]
1.7.x

[B]Short Description: [/B]
We are here to have fun, just as you are. Our server currently has 2 arenas. One of them is called “Catching Fire” while the other one is called “Steam”. Both maps are incredible. (We do not claim the “Steam” map as our own! The owner made most of the “Catching Fire” map with the help of other people. Although the center of it was copied from another map) Our server staff are also very friendly and are willing to help with any problem or complaint you have. We hope to have you join us here at Sunny Paradise! Also note that we just started so our playerbase isn’t too big. We could use your help in getting more players and attention!
The Hub has: Civcraft, Factions, Hungergames, PlotMe, Survival and finally, Roleplay!
Hope to see people joining :)!

[B]Pictures:[/B]
Note that we used shaders when taking these.
